item.title: Mediapart
item.description: Deux boîtes de nuit parisiennes pratiquent des tarifs différents selon la couleur de peau Mediapart a suivi SOS #Racisme pendant une nuit de #testing à Paris. À plusieurs reprises, l’aQuarium et L’Arc Paris, deux clubs réputés, ont conditionné l’entrée de personnes noires ou maghrébines à des coûts jusqu’à 10 fois plus élevés que pour des personnes blanches. › https://www.mediapart.fr/journal/france/050624/deux-boites-de-nuit-parisiennes-pratiquent-des-tarifs-differents-selon-la-couleur-de-peau

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description:
A #preprint detective story
"Our two laboratories encountered independently sudden-onset, major impediments to such research. Spore suspensions and vegetative cells no longer plated effectively on minimal media. By systematically analyzing multiple different media components from multiple different suppliers, we identified the source of the problem"
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.06.06.597796v1

item.title: Carl Zimmer

item.title: Everyday.Human Derek
item.description:
#Science #nature #neuroscience 4 days ago now YouTube published according to my feed a video that changed the way I thought.
Also about how I thought and strangely it made sense.
Earl Miller from MiT
😮.Seems fascinatingly.This took place in early spring at some neuroscience gathering I think in Arizona.
They are also on mastodon forgot to mention.
@ekmillerSeems fun🥰
Enjoy!
https://youtu.be/x1H0xxWrO7Mhttps://ekmillerlab.mit.edu/earl-miller/

item.title: mekka okereke :verified:
item.description:
@stux Only correction, but an important one.US school shooters don't get their guns "on the street."Guns are extremely expensive. US school shooters are usually rich, white, men and boys (~85%) and use guns legally owned by their families.I don't think people realize how expensive guns are, and how much US gun ownership is concentrated in rich, white, men.As you look at this picture, realize that each AR 15 costs about $1000.00.Photo source:
https://www.gabrielegalimberti.com/projects/1/N

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Tip: Read the "Withdrawn" blurbs on bioRxiv. Sometimes it's not what you think.For example, I submitted an update to a preprint and didn't do the submission the right way. I told bioRxiv right away and we got it sorted out.BioRxiv keeps the original mistaken submission, and the blurb explains where to find the correct DOI, but you have to cut-and-paste it yourself (and not everyone is DOI-savvy enough to know how to do that). There's no place to click and take you to the correct DOI.The unfortunate thing is that Google Scholar only indexes the mistake DOI, not the actual correct preprint DOI. So if you look it up on Google Scholar you just get a page that says "withdrawn" in all caps. Which can be misleading. We were just correcting a linking mistake at bioRxiv. The manuscript itself was not withdrawn. In fact, it has been peer reviewed and published at eLife. https://elifesciences.org/reviewed-preprints/97848 (Excellent work by Dr. Yiyi Yu-- check it out!!)I very much appreciate bioRxiv, and have been posting on there since 2014. I just wish they would handle these cases differently. Lumping these submission mistakes in with truly withdrawn manuscripts is potentially misleading. And not providing a clickable link makes it likely that some casual surfers won't find the paper they're looking for.

item.title: Andrew Plested
item.description: The 2nd edition of the Berlin Single Molecule Biophysics Course will be held this september. We will charge a fee for external participants but waivers and bursaries should be available if needed. Please retoot!#biophysics #ionchannels #physiology #TIRF https://www.biologie.hu-berlin.de/en/groupsites/cellbp/berlin-smb-course

item.title: Glenn Beltz
item.description: This past weekend, Delta Air Lines resumed service at Santa Barbara after a few years of hiatus. They have a pair of nonstops daily to Salt Lake City (which existed prior to the pandemic), as well as one flight to Atlanta (completely new), all using the Airbus A220. Here are a few photos I took. :dl:

https://goodscience.substack.com/p/strip-clubs-vs-academic-fraud
Total agreement with Stuart Buck - time to have more serious consequences for academic fraud that derails research progress
#researchIntegrity

item.title: Dan Goodman
item.description: Scientists spend ~20% of their time reading/writing grant apps. Recent study: review scores based on a half page abstract are statistically equivalent to scores of full apps. If scientists had to spend 1 day a week on one of these activities, which would be better for science?#academicchatter #science

item.title: Lluís Revilla
item.description: @PhilippBayer There is less people there too: "This number experienced a gradual decline over the subsequent seven months, showing a minor resurgence in July 2023 before continuing its descent, ultimately reaching 2,398 by October 2023. " Almost 1/3 moved to Mastodon according to table 1.
